lines.text: Median = middle value (or average of middle two)

definitions.def: The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values.
The number in the middle when the numbers in a set of values are arranged from smallest to largest.
The value that occurs most often in a set of values.

secText: The mean is one way to indicate a typical value. We calculate the mean of these five data values: 6, −3, −3, 6 and 4.
The sum here is 10. The count is 5 since there are 5 pieces of data: 6, −3, −3, 6, and 4. Dividing the sum by the count, we get a mean of 2.
The median and the mode can also be used to characterize a set of numbers. The median is the middle value when the values are arranged from smallest to largest.

We use the same data as above, but arrange it in order, and choose the middle value, 4, as the median. We have an odd number of values, so there is one middle number.  If we had an even number of values, we would average the middle two.
The mode is the value, or values, that show up most often. The numbers −3 and 6 both occur twice in our data, so they are modes.
